title: FAIL: TestParallelSleep
body:
by **anta40**: 
I just updated my go source code, and this was the latest commit, anyway:
changeset:   16999:cda3832e9a12
tag:         tip
user:        Anthony Martin <ality@pbrane.org>
date:        Tue Jun 04 17:30:45 2013 -0700
summary:     mime: add support for Plan 9


Tried to build it on 32-bit Windows 7 using gcc 4.8.0 from MinGW-builds project, and I
got this:
# ..\misc\cgo\test
--- FAIL: TestParallelSleep (1.00 seconds)
        basic.go:570: difference in start time for two sleep(1) is 230h50m49.392s
        basic.go:575: parallel 1-second sleeps slept for 831049.392000 seconds
FAIL
scatter = 00498F97
hello from C
FAIL    _/C_/go/misc/cgo/test   1.150s

Maybe I should revert back to previous version of gcc, like 4.7.2?
